sentences.sContent: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.sCn: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.sContent: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.sCn: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.sContent: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.sCn: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.sContent: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.sCn: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.sContent: ...knowing that it could all fall apart at any second...
...The thing that sets children apart from adults is not their ignorance...
...you'll discover that your world doesn't fall apart when you go offline...
...I was starting to feel like my whole world was falling apart – kind of slipping into a depression...

phrases.pCn: 远离，除…之外；且不说；缺少
截然相反；天壤之别；大相径庭

remMethod.val: a(…的) ＋ part(分开) → 分离的

trans.tranOther: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
